text: The Kingdom of Righteousness
See, a king will rule according to righteousness,
and princes will rule according to justice.
And each one will be like a hiding place from \add the\add* wind
and a covering from \add the\add* rainstorm,
like streams of water in a dry region,
like \add the\add* shade of a large rock in a weary land.
And \add the\add* eyes of those who see will not gaze,\f + \fr 32:3 \ft The same consonants with different vowels would be translated “be blinded,” which fits the context better \f*
and \add the\add* ears of those who hear will listen.
And \add the\add* ⸤minds⸥\f + \fr 32:4 \ft Literally “heart” \f* of \add the\add* rash will understand ⸤knowledge⸥,\f + \fr 32:4 \ft Literally “to know” \f*
and \add the\add* tongues\f + \fr 32:4 \ft Hebrew “tongue” \f* of stammerers will hasten to speak clearly.
A fool will no longer be called noble,
and a scoundrel will not be said \add to be\add* eminent.
For a fool speaks folly,
and his ⸤mind⸥\f + \fr 32:6 \ft Literally “heart” \f* does iniquity:
to ⸤behave wickedly⸥,\f + \fr 32:6 \ft Literally “do ungodliness” \f*
and to speak error concerning Yahweh,
to leave \add the\add* throat of \add the\add* hungry empty,
and he deprives \add the\add* thirsty \add of\add* drink.
And a scoundrel, his weapons \add are\add* evil;
he plans evil devices
to ruin \add the\add* poor with words of deception
even\f + \fr 32:7 \ft Or “and” \f* when the speech of \add the\add* needy \add is\add* right.
But\f + \fr 32:8 \ft Or “And” \f* \add the\add* nobleman plans noble things,
and he stands upon noble things.
Against the Carefree Women
Women \add who are\add* at ease, rise up; hear my voice!
Carefree daughters, listen \add to\add* my word!
⸤In a year⸥\f + \fr 32:10 \ft Literally “\fq In \ft days upon a year” \f* you will tremble, carefree ones,
for \add the\add* vintage will come to an end;
\add the\add* harvest will not come.
Tremble, \add you who are\add* at ease;
tremble, carefree ones;
strip, and strip yourself,

and gird yourself on \add your\add* loins,\f + \fr 32:11 \ft Although the carefree and at ease addressees in this verse are feminine plural (“you women”), the commands are masculine singular in form \f*
mourning over breasts,
over fields of delight,
over \add the\add* fruitful vine,
over the soil of my people.
It goes up \add in\add* thorns\f + \fr 32:13 \ft Hebrew “thorn” \f* \add and\add* briers,\f + \fr 32:13 \ft Hebrew “brier” \f*
indeed over all of \add the\add* houses of joy \add in the\add* jubilant city.
For \add the\add* palace will be forsaken,
\add the\add* ⸤crowded city⸥\f + \fr 32:14 \ft Literally “crowd of \fq the \ft city” \f* deserted;
\add the\add* hill and \add the\add* watchtower will become\f + \fr 32:14 \ft The Hebrew text has “for the benefit of” following “become” \f* a cave forever,
\add the\add* joy of wild asses, a pasture ⸤for⸥\f + \fr 32:14 \ft Literally “of” \f* flocks.
Until a spirit is poured out on us from on high,
and \add the\add* wilderness becomes \add a\add* fruitful field,
and \add the\add* fruitful field is reckoned as the forest.
Then\f + \fr 32:16 \ft Or “And” \f* justice will dwell in the wilderness,
and righteousness will live in the fruitful field.
And the work of righteousness will be peace,
and the work of righteousness, quietness and security forever.
And my people will dwell in a settlement of peace
and in a dwelling place of security
and in undisturbed resting places.
And it hails when ⸤the forest comes down⸥,\f + \fr 32:19 \ft Literally “the coming down of the forest” \f*
and the city will become low in humiliation.
Happy \add are\add* you who sow by all waters,
who let the foot of the ox and the donkey go free.
